page.title: 03STANWICK & FORCETT CHURCHES
page.content: { Stanwick church,}dedicated to St.John the Baptist, is an ancient stone structure, restored at the expense of {Eleanor,} the {dowager Duchess of {Northumberland,} in 1868. During this restoration, a number of German coins known as the {Nuremberg tokens} were found under the walls, these were a medium of exchange in England in the 15th. Cent., and thus indicate dates when previous building work was done. { Forcett church} is dedicated to St. Cuthbert and was restored in 1859. The registers date from 1595. Both vicarages have been sold, (that of Stanwick as recently as April 1985 following the retirement of the incumbent the Rev. K. Young) , and the two parishes are now run in plurality with {Aldbrough St.John.} { Stanwick's churchyard}has the unusual feature of being{circular}in shape.
